Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S10.text: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is according to godliness,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S11.text: in hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised before the world began,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S12.text: but hath in due times manifested His Word through preaching which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Savior,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S13.text: To Titus, my own son in the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S14.text: For this cause I left thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S15.text: if any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children, not accused of riot or unruly.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S16.text: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God, not selfwilled, not quick to anger, not given to wine, not violent, not given to filthy lucre;

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S17.text: but a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S18.text: holding fast the faithful Word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S19.text: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, especially those of the Circumcision,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S110.text: whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not for the sake of filthy lucre.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S111.text: One among themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, “The Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, slothful gluttons.”

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S112.text: This witness is true. Therefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S113.text: not giving heed to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn from the truth.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S114.text: Unto the pure, all things are pure; but unto those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure, but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S115.text: They profess that they know God, but in their works they deny Him, being abominable and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S20.text: But speak thou the things which befit sound doctrine:

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S21.text: that the older men be sober, serious, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience;

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S22.text: the older women likewise, that they be in behavior as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S23.text: that they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S24.text: to be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the Word of God be not blasphemed.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S25.text: Likewise exhort the young men to be soberminded,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S26.text: in all things showing thyself to be a pattern of good works; in doctrine showing uncorruptness, seriousness, sincerity,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S27.text: sound speech which cannot be condemned, that he that is of a contrary mind may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S28.text: Exhort servants to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please them well in all things, not gainsaying,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S29.text: not purloining, but showing all good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in all things.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S210.text: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S211.text: teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly in this present world,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S212.text: looking for that blessed hope and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Savior Jesus Christ,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S213.text: These things speak and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S30.text: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready for every good work,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S31.text: to speak evil of no man, not to be brawlers, but gentle, showing all meekness unto all men.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S32.text: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful and hating one another.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S33.text: But after the kindness and love of God our Savior toward man appeared,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S34.text: He saved us not by works of righteousness which we had done, but according to His mercy, by the washing of regeneration, and by the renewing of the Holy Ghost,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S35.text: which He shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Savior,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S36.text: that, being justified by His grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S37.text: This is a faithful saying, and these things I enjoin that thou affirm constantly, that those who have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S38.text: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law, for they are unprofitable and vain.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S39.text: If a man is a heretic, after the first and second admonition reject him,

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S310.text: knowing that such as he is subverted and sinneth, being condemned by himself.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S311.text: When I send Artemas unto thee or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me in Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S312.text: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S313.text: And let our own also learn to perform good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

Titus2coOAF2dByWwsL1S314.text: All that are with me salute thee. Greet those who love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
